data.title: Alfonso VI of Castile
data.text:




Once again thank you for another helpful work.

There are several additions in the portugueese descent that I will

post here for the benefit of all who may be interested but also for

the usefull scrutiny of Todd and Maria Emma.

[Names, some titles and jobs in portuguese]

1 - 18/10/2007

4 Afonso I 'o

Conquistador'

King of Portugal

1139-1185

Born 25 July 1110

Guimaraens

Died 6 December 1185

Coimbra

Married

1146

Matilde de Savoie, daughter of Amadeo III, Comte de

Savoie

1103-1148 and Mathilde

d'Albon

Died 4 November 1157

Coimbra

Buried Santa Cruz de Coimbra

Children (a) by Unknown

Children (b) by Elvira

Gualter

Children, Generation III-1

III-1

(II-1-4)

1 Mahaud of Portugal

..............

2 Urraca of

Portugal

..............

3 Sancho I 'o

Povoador'

..............

4. D. Henrique, Infante de Portugal, b. 5 Mar 1447, d.in

infancy

5. D. Mafalda, Infanta de Portugal

Her marriage was contracted with Alfonso II, King of

Aragon but she died before. [please note that 1. Mahaud was christened

Teresa and only became known as Mahaud (Matilde=Mafalda) in Flanders]

6. D. João, Infante de Portugal b. ca. 1160 d.young 25

Aug ????

7. D. Sancha, Infanta de Portugal b. ca. 1660 d. in

infancy 14.12.????

(a) 8. D. Fernando Afonso, alferes-mór

(a) 9. D. Pedro Afonso, Master of the Order of Aviz, b. ca.

1130, d. 9 May 1169

Was in the battles of Ourique and Trancoso and in the

conquest of Santarém.

Went to France "in his brother's service" and joined

the Order St. Bernard (Cluny).

Buried in Alcobaça.

(a) 10. D. Afonso de Portugal, 11. Master of the Order of Malta

1203-1206, b. ca. 1135, d. 1 Mar 1207

(a) 11. D. Teresa Afonso, b. ca. 1135

[not mentioned in some genealogies and mentioned in

others with two husbands which are most commonly attributed to an aunt

D. Sancha Henriques]

(b) 12. D. Urraca Afonso, senhora de Aveiro, b. ca. 1135

Married Pedro Afonso Viegas, son of Afonso Viegas "o

Moço" and wife Aldara Peres. Tenente [literally lieutenant, in the

epoch a military commander, the king's deputy in a castle or a region]

of Trancoso 1184 and Neiva 1187.

Descent:

1 D. Abril Peres, senhor do couto de Lumiares, b. ca. 1190, d. 1245

Vila Nova de Gaia. Marr. D. Sancha Nunes de Barbosa, dau. of D. Nuno

Sanches de Barbosa and wife Teresa Álvares de Soverosa.

1.1 D. Pedro Abril de Lumiares, n.m., s.p.

1.2 D. Nuno Abril de Lumiares, n.m., s.p.

1.3 D. Urraca Abril de Lumiares, b. ca. 1210.

Marr.1 ca. 1240 João Martins de Riba de Vizela "Chora" d. ca.

1250, son of Martim Anes de Riba de Vizela and wife Estevainha Pais

Gabere, Rico-homem [the highest nobility title in the epoch (later

declined and was last given in the XV century)] of king D. Sancho II,

tenente de Maia and Covilhã.

1.3.1 Pedro Anes Gago de Riba de Vizela (1240-1286), Rico-homem of

kings D. Afonso III and D. Dinis, Tenente de Traserra 1265-1283,

Lafões 1266-1271 Beira (province of) 1268-1269 and Covilhã 1279-1283.

Marr. May 1265 D. Urraca Afonso de Portugal, dau. of D. Afonso III

king of Portugal and concubine Madragana (later christened as Mor

Afonso)

1.3.1.1 D. Aldara Pires de Riba de Vizela, marr. João Pires Portel,

Rico-homem of king D. Dinis (attested royal charters 1298-1304). S.p.

(3.1. above)

Marr.2 D. Fernão Garcia de Sousa (ca.1200-1256), Rico-Homem of

kings D. Sancho II and D. Afonso III, tenente de Gouveia 1224,

Celorico, 1230 and Maia 1250. Troubador, followed the party of D.

Afonso III against D. Sancho II [that was deposed]. S.p.

To follow.

Best regards,

Francisco

On 6 Out, 02:55, "Leo van de Pas" <leovd...@netspeed.com.au> wrote:



2 - 4/11/2007 (erased by mistake re-published 6/11)

Portuguese names added between ##

Contradictory information between %%

Information added between {}

Comments between []

III-1 (II-1-4)

1 Mahaud of Portugal

...............

2 Urraca of Portugal

................

3 Sancho I 'o Povoador'

King of Portugal 1185-1212

Born 11 November 1154 Coimbra

Died 26 March 1212 Coimbra

Buried Santa Cruz de Coimbra

Married 1174

Dulce of Barcelona, daughter of Raymund Berengar IV, Conde

de Barcelona and Petronella , Queen of Aragón 1137-1163

Born circa 1159

Died 1 September 1198 Coimbra

Buried Santa Cruz de Coimbra

Children by (a) Maria Ayres de Fornellos, Señora de

Villanova, daughter of Ayres Nunez de Fornellos and Mayor

Pirez # (a) Maria Aires de Fornelos#, #senhora de Vila

Nova# [there are dozens of Vila Nova "new village/city" in

Portugal; I found no evidence that she was lady of any of

them], daughter of #Aires Nunes de Fornelos# and %N...%

[Felgueiras Gayo and Sottomayor Pizarro don't identify the

mother; I did not looked in others]

Children by (b) Maria Paez de Ribera #Maria Paes da Ribeira#

{"a Ribeirinha"}, Señora de Villa del Conde #Senhora de Vila

do Conde#, daughter of Payo Moniz #Paio Moniz# and Urraca

Nunes {also Urraca Nunes Bragança}

Children, Generation IV-2

IV-2 (III-1-3)

1 Teresa of Portugal #D. Teresa, infanta de Portugal#

{senhora de Montemor-o-Velho e de Esgueira}

Born circa 1176 {Coimbra}

Died 18 June 1250 Lorvano #Lorvão#

Buried Lorvano #Lorvão#

Married 15 February 1191 Guimaraes Annulled

Alfonso IX, King of León 1188-1230, son of Fernando II,

King of León 1157-1188 and Urraca of Portugal

Born 1171

Died 24 September 1230

Buried Santiago de Compostella

{after the annulment she became a nun in Mosteiro

"Monastery" de Lorvão; beatifyed by Pope Clement XI 23

December 1705}

Children, Generation V-2

2 Sancha of Portugal #D. Sancha, infanta de Portugal#

Senhora de Alenquer [only 1/3 of the lordship as the

other 2/3 belonged to the Mosteiro de S. João de

Tarouca; D. Sancha bought that 1/3 and later granted

it in donation to the Mosteiro de Celas in Coimbra]

{abess of Celas and abess of Lorvão; beatifyed 1705}

Born circa 1178

Died 13 March 1229 Lorvano #Lorvão#

Buried Lorvano #Mosteiro de Lorvão#

3 Raimundo of Portugal #D. Raimundo, infante de Portugal#

Born circa 1180

Died circa 9 March 1189 {Coimbra}

Buried Coimbra

4 Constança of Portugal #D. Constança, infanta de Portugal#

Born May 1182 Coimbra [I found no evidence for Coimbra]

Died 3 August 1202 Lorvano #Lorvão#

Buried Lorvano #Mosteiro de Lorvão#

5 Afonso II 'o Gordo'

King of Portugal 1212%1211%-1223 [the father died 26 March

1211 and there was no time lost in elections :-) ]

Born 12 April 1185 /23 April 1185 Coimbra [23 April 1185]

Died 25 March 1223 Santarem %Coimbra%

Buried Alcobaca #Mosteiro de Alcobaça#

Married 1206 %1208%

Urraca of Castile, daughter of Alfonso VIII, King of

Castile 1158-1214 and Eleanor of England

Born 1186 /1187

Died 3 November 1220 {Coimbra}

{buried Mosteiro de Alcobaça}

Child by (a) NN

Children, Generation V-3

6 Infante Pedro of Portugal #D. Pedro, infante de Portugal#

King of Majorca, Conde de Urgel

Born 23 February 1187 Coimbra

Died 2 June 1258 Majorca

Married 25 July 1229

Arumbaix, Condesa de Urgel, daughter of Armengol VIII,

Conde de Urgel and Elvira de Narbonne {married (1) Álvaro

Pérez de Castro, s.p.}

Died August 1231

Children by (a) NN

Children, Generation V-4

7 Ferrante of Portugal #D. Fernando, infante de Portugal#

Born 24 March 1188 {Coimbra}

Died 27 July 1233 {Noyon}

Married 1212

Johanna, Countess of Flanders, Hainault and Namur, daughter

of Baudouin VI-IX, Count of Flanders, Emperor of

Constantinople and Marie de Champagne

Born 1188

Died 5 December 1244

[Fought with the english against Philippe Auguste, king of

France, commanding the left wing in Bouvines's battle; was

made a prisonner and stayed several years imprisioned in

the Louvre; released 1227 by king Saint Louis]

Children, Generation V-5

8 Enrique of Portugal #D. Henrique, infante de Portugal#

Born 1189

Died 8 December 1191 ? [or 8 February year unknown]

Buried Coimbra

9 Branca of Portugal #D. Branca, infanta de Portugal#

Senora de Guadalajara #senhora de Guadalajara#

Born circa 1192

Died 17 November 1240 Guadalajara

Buried Coimbra

10 Berengaria of Portugal

#D. Berengária, infanta de Portugal#

Born circa 1194 {Coimbra}

Died 27 March 1221 Ringsted

Buried Ringsted

Married 1213 /1214

Valdemar II Sejr, King of Denmark 1202-1241, son of

Valdemar I den Store, King of Denmark 1157-1182 and Sofie

of Polock

Born 28 June 1170

Died 28 March 1241 Vordingborg

Buried Ringsted

Children, Generation V-6

11 Mafalda of Portugal #D. Mafalda, infanta de Portugal#

Born circa 1197

Married 1215 Medina (annuled 1216)

Henrique I, king of Castile 1214-1217

Born 1204

Died Palencia 1217

{Became a nun in the Convent of Arouca}

Died 1 May 1257 Arouca near Lisboa %not near Lisboa%

{Beatifyed 27 September 1792}

[the actually preferred form "D. X, infante de Portugal"

can also be correctly "infante D. X of Portugal"]

[all the children of king D. Sancho I were also referred

with the patronynic Sanches, e.g. D. Mafalda Sanches]

The illegitimate children will follow.

Best regards,

Francisco

On 6 Out, 02:55, "Leo van de Pas" <leovd...@netspeed.com.au> wrote:

3 - 6/11/2007

Corrections:

Msg 1 (18 Oct) At the end where is (3.1 above is well 1.3)

Msg 2 (4 Nov)

Maria Aires de Fornelos, senhora de Vila Nova, Colares and Silvares.

Maria Paes de Ribeira, senhora de Vila do Conde, Parada, Pousadela and

Pereiró.

[all of them granted by D. Sancho I; except for Vila do Conde the

others were most probably small villages; I could not identify Vila

Nova]

[Leo has sent me back to school :-)]

Portuguese and castilian names added between ##

Contradictory information between %%

Information added between {}

Comments between []

III-1 (II-1-4)

.........

.........

(a) 12 Martim Sanches bâtard de Portugal #D. Martim Sanches#

1. Conde de Trastamara

Died circa 1260 %Born circa 1200, died circa 1229%

Married *

Ella (Eulaya) Perez de Castro #Eulalia Pérez de Castro#, Senora

#Señora# de Santa Olahla y Iscar, daughter of Pedro Fernando de Castro

de Castilla %Pedro Fernández de Castro "el Castillano"# [a paternal

grandson of Rodrigo Fernández de Castro "Calvo" and gggrandson of

Sancho I, king of Aragón and Navarra, and maternal grandson of Alfonso

VII, king of Castile],and Ximenez Gomez #Ximena Gómez de Manzanedo#

S.P.

13 Urraca Sanches bâtarde de Portugal #D. Urraca Sanches#

Died after 1256

Married *

Lourenço Suarez de Viegas-Villadarez #[Lourenço Soares, died 28

September 1222, son of Soeiro Viegas and wife D. Sancha Bermudez de

Trava, Rico-homem, tenente de Lamego, buried Mosteiro de Salzedas]#

S.P. %descent:%

1. D. Egas Lourenço "o Bom", married Mafalda Jordão; "went to Castile

with his children (only 1 recorded)", buried Mosteiro de Santa María

de la Huerta

1.1. Pedro Venegas, married Teresa Martínez de Finojosa, conqueror of

Cordoba, was in the battle of Navas de Tolosa, buried Mosteiro de

Santa María de la Huerta

1.1.1. Egas Venegas, 2. señor de Venegas, married circa 1290 Mayor

Fernández de Castro, daughter of Esteban Fernández de Castro, señor de

Lemos and wife Aldonza Rodriguez

1.1.1.1. Pedro Venegas, 3. Señor de Venegas, married Leonor Fernández

de Cordoba, daughter of Alfonso Fernández de Cordoba and wife Teresa

Ximenez de Gongora

1.1.1.1.1. Egas Venegas, 1. señor de Luque, married Beatriz de Tolosan

1.1.1.1.1.1. Pedro Venegas, 2. señor de Luque, married María Fernández

de Cordoba. Daughter of Gonzalo Fernández de Cordoba, 1. señor de

Aguilar and wife María Garcia Carrillo, señora de Villaquíran de las

Infantas (3 children)

1.1.1.1.1.2. Teresa Venegas, married Alfonso Fernández de Cordoba, 2.

señor de Aguillar, died 1424, full brother of María Fernández de

Cordoba above (2 children)

Notes:

The source for the first generations is an non edited work "Genealogia

da Família Cancella, de Anadia" by Lopo de Carvalho Cancella de Abreu.

I did not saw it so I can not evaluate it. It must be mainly an

ahnentafel and more children may exist; the possibility that it is

just un unfounded link to royaltie is negligible as Cancella de Abreu

is a well known family and they have other lines to royalty.

The last generation is covered in "Titulos Nobiliarios Andaluces" by

Jorge Valverde Fraikin, Ed. Andalucia, Granada, 1991



On 6 Out, 02:55, "Leo van de Pas" <leovd...@netspeed.com.au> wrote:



4 -11/11/2007

Corrections:

Msg 3 - 6 November

(a) 12 Martim Sanches bâtard de Portugal #D. Martim Sanches#

.......

%Pedro Fernández de Castro 'el Castellano'# [a paternal grandson of

Rodrigo Fernández de Castro "Calvo" and ggggrandson of Sancho IV 'el

de Nájera', king of Navarra, and maternal grandson of Alfonso VII,

king of Castile],and Ximenez Gomez #Ximena Gómez de Manzanedo#

S.P.

Portuguese and castilian names added between ##

Contradictory information between %%

Information added between {}

Comments between []

III-1 (II-1-4)

.........

.........

(b)14 Rodrigo Sanches bâtard de Portugal

#D. Rodrigo Sanches#

Died 1245 {2 July 1245) near Oporto {Gaia=Vila Nova de Gaia} in battle

Buried Grijo #Mosteiro de Grijó#

Married * %affaire with%

NN {Constança Afonso de Cambra, daughter of Afonso Anes de Cambra and

wife Urraca Pires da Ribeira}

Children, Generation V-7

15 Gil Sanches bâtard de Portugal #D. Gil Sanches#

Died 14 September 1236

Buried Coimbra Santa Cruz

{Clergyman and troubadour, gave a charter (carta de foral) to the

people of Sarzedas January 1213; received 8.000 "morabitinos" (or gold

dinars) in his father's will}

Married * [concubine]

%D.% Maria Garcia de Sousa, daughter of %D.% Garcia Mendes de Sousa

and Elvira Gonçalez-Paes de Torronho #Elvira Gonçalves (de Toronho)#

S.P.

16 Nuno Sanches bâtard de Portugal #D. Gil Sanches#

Died young {16 December year unknown}

17 Mayor Sanches bâtarde de Portugal #D. Maior Sanches#

{A nun}

Buried Santa Cruz, Coimbra

18 Tereza Sanches bâtarde de Portugal #D. Teresa Sanches#

{Born Coimbra}

Died 1230

Married Afonso Telo de Menezes #[the name in portuguese should be

Afonso Teles de Menezes but he was not portuguese] Alfonso Tellez de

Menezes#, {1.} Señor d'Albuquerque, 2.Señor de Menezes, {son of Telo

Perez, 1. señor de Menezes and wife Ximena Ordoñez}

Died 1230

Children, Generation V-8

19 Costanza Sanches bâtarde de Portugal #D. Constança Sanches#

'the Pious'

{A nun in Convento das Donas}

Born 1204 [some sources say 1210]

Died 8 August 1269 Coimbra Santa Cruz %not Santa Cruz (a male

monastery and a church) but probably died in Convento das Donas;

buried in Santa Cruz%

Notes:

a) There are more doubts than certainties in the chronology of D.

Sancho's illegitimate children. I will post the basic information when

possible.

b) It is argued if Dom/Dona (abbreviated D.) is a title or a style and

it's use has changed along the time. In this epoch all the children of

kings had the Dom/Dona but only the infants, the legitimate, could

transmit it to their children. As all the portuguese rules/customs

there were exceptions, some by the king's decision others we do not

know why.

c) The style "of Portugal" was not used and it is a modern convention

or probably a modern fashion; however when an infant went abroad could

be so mentioned in documents and the same for illegitimate and some

nobles of high rank. This was the case of III-1 (II-1-4) (a) 12 styled

in Portugal D. Martim Sanches but also D. Martin Sanchez de Portugal

in Galicia and Castile.

d) With not more than a handfull of exceptions, women had a given name

and a patronymic and with much more exceptions the same was true for

men. The above mentioned Alfonso Tellez de Menezes probably was never

mentioned as de Menezes and his children were the first generation to

adopt de Menezes; only for easier identification family names are

given to women, sometimes between brackets as Elvira Gonçalves (de

Toronho).

Best regards,

Francisco

On 6 Out, 22:39, maria emma escobar <memaesco...@yahoo.es> wrote:

> Leo, please send me the adress of the file about Alfonso VI and his descendant. I can not find it.

>

> Thank you very much

>

> María Emma Escobar Uribe

>

> De: "Leo van de Pas" <leovd...@netspeed.com.au>

> Para: <GEN-MEDIEVA...@rootsweb.com>

> Fecha: Sat, 6 Oct 2007 11:55:23 +1000

> Asunto: Alfonso VI of Castile

>

> Thanks to Todd Farmerie and three other people, I think I have improved the information about Alfonso VI and his descendants.

> In several generations they can be found established in several other countries.

>

> I have made a file but I am sure there are still lots of details missing and I hope people are willing to have a look at this file.

>

> With best wishes

> Leo van de Pas

> Canberra, Australia

>

> ---------------------------------

>

> Sé un Mejor Amante del Cine

> ¿Quieres saber cómo? ¡Deja que otras personas te ayuden!.

5 - 19/11/2007

Portuguese and castilian names added between ##

Contradictory information between %%

Information added between {}

Comments between []

V-3 (IV-2-5)

1 Sancho II 'o Capelo' #D. Sancho II 'o Capelo'#

King of Portugal 1223-1245

Born 8 September 1207

Died 3 January 1248 {Toledo}

{Buried in Toledo's Cathedral}

Married circa 1246

Mencia López de Haro, daughter of Lopo III Diaz de Haro,

Soberano de Viscaya and Urraca Alfonso de León

[married 1. as his 2.

marriage Álvaro Pérez de Castro (1.Marriage with Arumbaix, countess of

Urgel annulled on consanguinity basis) son of Pedro Fernández de

Castro 'el Castellano' and wife Ximena Gómez de Manzanedo]

Died after 1270 {Palencia}

S.P.

2 Afonso III 'o Bolonhés' #D. Afonso III 'o Bolonhês'#

King of Portugal 1248-1279

Count of Boulogne

Born 5 May 1210 Coimbra

Died 16 February 1279 Lisboa

Buried Alcobaca #Mosteiro de Alcobaça#

Married (1) 1235 / 1238 Div.1253 [The marriage was

never annulled; on the contrary, after strong protests of

countess Mafalda Pope Alexander IV excommunicated both Afonso and

Beatriz. The death of Countess Mafalda in 1258 did not change things

neither demoved the Pope and Mass and any other celebrations became

forbiden wherever the royal couple stayed. The marriage was

only recognised and the children born legitimated by Pope

Urban IV after representations of the bishops presented in Rome by the

bishops of Coimbra and Lisbon and intercession of Louis IX, king of

France, Theobald, king of Navarra and Charles, count of Anjou]

Mafalda de Dammartin, Comtesse de Boulogne, daughter of

Renaud I de Dammartin, Comte de Boulogne, Comte d'Aumale

and Ida of Flanders, Comtesse de Boulogne

Born circa 1202

Died 14 January 1262 #1258# [The years of 1259, 1260

and 1262 are commonly given to the countess death but there is

no reasonable doubt that 1258 is correct]

Married (2) 1253 [The marriage was part of a peace

settlement between kings Afonso III and Alfonso X and probably was not

consummated until the death of countess Mafalda as the first child was

born 28 February 1259]

Beatriz of Castile, Heiress of Alcozea, Salmeran &

Vadesliras, daughter of Alfonso X, King of Castile and

León 1252-1284 and Maria Guillen de Guzmán

Born 1242

Died 27 October 1303

Buried Alcobaco #Mosteiro de Alcobaça#

Children by (a) Mariana Pirez #Maria Peres# de Enxara

[Called Mariana, Marina and Maria, she is mentioned in a donation to

her son as Marine Petri de Eyxara. Without the double nn I would not

consider Mariana; nor Marina a rather modern name. Marine could be an

error for Mariae]

Children by (b) Mourana Gil #[even if it is

sometimes written as Mouroana and other less representative

variations, the most common and easier identifiable name is Madragana

(without Gil) daughter of Aloandro [Aloandro ben Bekar or ben Bakr the

last alcayde of the town of Faro under moorish rule. He was a

'moçárabe' a christian under moorish rule of jewish ancestry and some

say a descendant of the Exilarchs of Babylon and from the House of

David] [She was probably given to D. Afonso III by her father and took

the name of Mor Afonso - christened or confirmed as most probably she

was already a christian - and after having two children with

him the king promoted her marriage with Fernão Rei]

Child by (c) Elvira Estevez #Elvira Esteves#

Children by (d) NN

Children, Generation VI-9

3 Eleonora of Portugal #D. Leonor, infanta de Portugal#

Born 1211

Died 28 August 1231 %13 May 1231%

Buried Ringsted Kirke

Married June 1229 Ribe {24 June 1229 (date of contract)}

Valdemar III den Unge, King of Denmark {1218-1231}, son

of Valdemar II Sejr, King of Denmark 1202-1241 %1202-1218% [Valdemar

abdicated in the town of Schleswig 1218] and Margrete (Dagmar) of

Bohemia

Born 1209

Died 28 November 1231 Revsnaes near Kalundborg

Children, Generation VI-10

4 Fernando of Portugal #D. Fernando, infante de Portugal#

Senhor de Serpa e Lamego %only Serpa%

Born 1217

[Lived mainly in Castile serving kings Alfonso X and

Fernando III in the wars against the moors. Was in the conquest of

Murcia and in 1239 the Pope Gregorius IX rewarded his military

commitment with the same indulgences granted to crusaders]

Died 19 January 1246

Married 1242

Sancha Fernández de Lara, daughter of Fernando Nunez de

Lara, Conde, Señor de Castrogeriz and Mayor Garcés de

Aza

Children, Generation VI-11

5 Vicente of Portugal #D. Vicente, infante de Portugal#

Born circa 1219

Died young

Buried Alcobace #Mosteiro de Alcobaça#

(a) 6 Joao Affonso bâtard de Portugal #João Afonso#

Died 9 October 1234

Buried Alcobace Monastery #Mosteiro de Alcobaça, Claustro do

Silêncio#

{7 Pedro Afonso

Born ca. 1210

Was in the conquest of Faro 1249

It is not known if he was married or not but was father of a

daughter Constança Pires, without further notice}

V-4 (IV-2-6)

(a) 1 Rodrigo 'il Magnifico' bâtard de Urgel #D. Rodrigo de

Portugal#

Buried Coimbra Santa Cruz

2 Fernando Pedro bâtard de Urgel #D. Fernando Pedro de

Portugal#

Buried Coimbra Santa Cruz

V-5 (IV-2-7)

1 Marie of Portugal [or Marie, comtesse de Flandre]

Died young

{Born 1224}

{Died 1236}

V-7 (IV-2-14)

1 Alfonso Rodriguez #Afonso Rodrigues#

[Franciscan friar, Guardian of Lisbon's Convent]

Died after 1294

Best regards,

Francisco



6 - 17/11/2007

Portuguese and castilian names added between ##

Contradictory information between %%

Information added between {}

Comments between []

VI-9 (V-3-2)

(2) 1 Infant Affonso of Portugal #D. Afonso, infante de Portugal)#

Senor de Portalegre #senhor de Portalegre#

{senhor de Castelo de Vide, Arronches, Marvão,

Lourinhã, etc., governor of Viseu, Lamego and Trás-

os-Montes

Born 8 February 1263 (Lisboa)

Died 2 November 1312 Lisboa

{Buried Convento de São Domingos, Lisboa}

Married circa 1287

{Infanta} Violante Manuel of Castile, Señora de Elche y

Medellin,

daughter of Manuel {infant} of Castile, Señor de Escalona,

Peñafiel y Villena

Born circa 1265

Died 1314 Lisboa

Children, Generation VII-17

(1) 2 Roberto of Portugal #D. Roberto, infante de Portugal#

Born circa 1239

Died in infancy

3 NN of Portugal #NN, infant of Portugal#

Born circa 1240

b) For the missing two legitimate children I gave numbers 8* and 9*

without changing the numbers of the illegitimate.

c) In the reign of D. Afonso III the use of Dom was severely

restricted and not given to his illegitimate sons; however due to the

custom, some of them are so mentioned in some documents.

Notes:

The main source is "Nobiliário das Famílias de Portugal" by Manuel

José da Costa Felgueiras Gaio (1750-1831) a judge. It is one of the

two biggest genealogical works in Portugal but not one of the most

reliable.

Felgueiras Gaio mainly copied older works - that was the only way to

write such an huge work - rarely mentioned primary sources and only

exceptionally gives dates.

Gaio clearly wrote a nobiliary and sons that decayed or daughters that

married below their status were ignored or mentioned once without

further notice.

I do not know where Leo got the information but it was clearly from

Gaio, not complete and with added dates, exactly the same that can be

seen in GeneAll, a portuguese genealogical site, where the dates were

estimated sometimes with 8 or 10 generations between two known dates.

Roughly the first part is also covered by "Linhagens Medievais

Portuguesas" - 3 vols, José Augusto de Sotto Mayor Pizarro,

Universidade Moderna, 1ª Edição, Porto, 1999 a very reliable work; the

middle and last parts are only from Gaio but the last part, the Varela

connecting with Fonseca Coutinho and Gomes da Silva, two known and

important families, has been scrutinized by modern authors without

divergences that I heard about.

Best regards,

Francisco
